tit.e: Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period)
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period)
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period)

sen.j: 朽木 稙綱（くつき たねつな、明応7年（1498年） - 天文 (元号)15年（1546年））は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (1498 - 1546) was a busho in the Sengoku period.
Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (1498 - 1546) was a busho in the Sengoku period (period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。説明訳補足しました、
sen.e: Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (1498 - 1546) was a busho in the Sengoku period (period of Warring States).
He was a Kokujin (local samurai) in Kutsuki-dani, Omi Province.
He was a Kokujin (local samurai) in Kutsuki-dani, Omi Province.
He was a Kokujin (local samurai) in Kutsuki-dani, Omi Province.

sen.j: 朽木貞清の子、朽木晴綱の父。
sen.e: He was a child of Sadakiyo KUTSUKI and father of Harutsuna KUTSUKI.
He was a child of Sadakiyo KUTSUKI and father of Harutsuna KUTSUKI.
He was a child of Sadakiyo KUTSUKI and father of Harutsuna KUTSUKI.

sen.j: 朽木氏に関して活字史料としては『朽木文書』（以下「同文書」）に数多くの文書が残されており、稙綱も史料中に多く登場する。
sen.e: Many printed historical materials related to the Kutsuki clan are listed in "Kutsuki Monjo" (documents of the Kutsuki family, hereinafter referred to as Document), and Tanetsuna appears often in the materials.

Many printed historical materials related to the Kutsuki clan are listed in "Kutsuki Monjo" (documents of the Kutsuki family, hereinafter referred to as Document), and Tanetsuna appears often in the materials.

Many printed historical materials related to the Kutsuki clan are listed in "Kutsuki Monjo" (documents of the Kutsuki family, hereinafter referred to as Document), and Tanetsuna appears often in the materials.

sen.j: 同文書内での初見は永正2年（1505年）で「竹松」という幼名で登場。
sen.e: His first appearance in the Document is in 1505 as his childhood name 'Takematsu'.
His first appearance in the Document is in 1505 as his childhood name 'Takematsu.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: His first appearance in the Document is in 1505 as his childhood name 'Takematsu.'

sen.j: 室町幕府奉行人の飯尾元行、松田頼亮から奉書を受け取っている。
sen.e: He received hosho (a document for informing lower-rank people of the decision of upper people such as an emperor or shogun) from bugyoshu (group of magistrates) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) Motoyuki INO and Yorisuke MATSUDA.

He received hosho (a document for informing lower-rank people of the decision of upper people such as an emperor or shogun) from bugyoshu (group of magistrates) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) Motoyuki INO and Yorisuke MATSUDA.

He received hosho (a document for informing lower-rank people of the decision of upper people such as an emperor or shogun) from bugyoshu (group of magistrates) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) Motoyuki INO and Yorisuke MATSUDA.

sen.j: 正確な元服年はわからないが、永正13年（1516年）には室町幕府10代将軍・足利義稙の偏諱を受けて「稙広」と名乗っている（足利義稙が義尹から義稙に改名した年月から推定すると、稙綱が元服したのは永正10年（1514年）から同13年までの間と考えられる）。
sen.e: The exact year of his genpuku (celebrate one's coming of age) is unknown, but in 1516, he was granted to use a portion of the real name of the 10th shogun in the Muromachi shogunate Yoshitane ASHIKAGA and called himself 'Tanehiro' (estimating from the year and month when Yoshitane Ashikaga changed his name from Yoshitada to Yoshitane, Tanetsuna's genpuku is considered to be between 1514 and 1517).

The exact year of his genpuku (celebrate one's coming of age) is unknown, but in 1516, he was granted to use a portion of the real name of the 10th shogun in the Muromachi shogunate Yoshitane ASHIKAGA and called himself 'Tanehiro' (estimating from the year and month when Yoshitane Ashikaga changed his name from Yoshitada to Yoshitane, Tanetsuna's genpuku is considered to be between 1514 and 1517).

The exact year of his genpuku (celebrate one's coming of age) is unknown, but in 1516, he was granted to use a portion of the real name of the 10th shogun in the Muromachi shogunate Yoshitane ASHIKAGA and called himself 'Tanehiro' (estimating from the year and month when Yoshitane Ashikaga changed his name from Yoshitada to Yoshitane, Tanetsuna's genpuku is considered to be between 1514 and 1517).

sen.j: 大永2年（1522年）から同4年の間に稙綱と改名。
sen.e: He changed his name to Tanetsuna during the four year period starting from 1522.
He changed his name to Tanetsuna during the four year period starting from 1522.
He changed his name to Tanetsuna during the four year period starting from 1522.
His job grade was Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
His job grade was Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
His job grade was Minbu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 近江国の六角氏や京極氏と争い、あくまで独立を維持していたが、名将・六角定頼が勢力を拡大してくると、その配下として服属せざるを得なくなったという。
sen.e: He competed with the Rokkaku clan and Kyogoku clan in Omi Province and consistently maintained independence, but as a great commander Sadayori ROKKAKU expanded his influence, Tanetsuna had no other choice than to yield allegiance as his subordinate.

He competed with the Rokkaku clan and Kyogoku clan in Omi Province and consistently maintained independence, but as a great commander Sadayori ROKKAKU expanded his influence, Tanetsuna had no other choice than to yield allegiance as his subordinate.

He competed with the Rokkaku clan and Kyogoku clan in Omi Province and consistently maintained independence, but as a great commander Sadayori ROKKAKU expanded his influence, Tanetsuna had no other choice than to yield allegiance as his subordinate.

sen.j: 1525年の浅井攻めでは、六角定頼軍の先鋒を務めている。
sen.e: In the attack on Asai in 1525, he served as the spearhead of the Sadayori Rokkaku's army.
In the attack on Asai in 1525, he served as the spearhead of the Sadayori Rokkaku's army.
In the attack on Asai in 1525, he served as the spearhead of the Sadayori Rokkaku's army.
